thread.title: danjmartin published Zuffar Haq appointed as Lib Dem's Brexit spokesman
thread.title_full: danjmartin published Zuffar Haq appointed as Lib Dem's Brexit spokesman

author: danjmartin
title: danjmartin published Zuffar Haq appointed as Lib Dem's Brexit spokesman
text:
Zuffar Haq appointed as Lib Dem's Brexit spokesman By danjmartin | Posted: February 03, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Zuffar Haq appointed as Lib Dem's Brexit spokesman   
Harborough prospective parliamentary candidate Zuffar Haq has been appointed the Liberal Democrats' East Midlands spokesman for Brexit. 
The party is opposed to Britain quitting the European Union despite the referendum result last summer. 
Mr Haq said he would fight to reduce the "damage of Brexit" for people across the region. 
He said 200,000 jobs in the East Midlands were linked to trade with the Single Market. 
Read more: Leicester's three Labour MPs back Brexit Bill despite city's narrow vote to remain 
Mr Haq added: "The East Midlands is hugely dependent on trade with the Single Market, especially its metals, clothing, manufacturing and automobile industries. 
"Overall, businesses in the East Midlands sell around Â£8.5 billion a year to the EU, 43.8 per cent of the region's total exports. 
"Theresa May's decision to take us out of the Single Market will have a devastating effect on the economy of the East Midlands and I will fight tooth and nail for local people to ensure that jobs and prosperity are protected." 
Nick Clegg, Liberal Democrat Shadow Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union, said: "Zuffar Haq is going to do an excellent job of holding the government to account as the Conservative's drag us out of Europe and the Single Market. 
"The Liberal Democrats will continue to fight for a fair deal for the people of the East Midlands."
